DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Contrast Agent Bolus Infusion Procedure Timing Method Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category of the method used to administer an intravenous contrast agent over time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Intravenous Route of Administration Contrast Agent Test Dosing Unit Bolus Infusion Procedure Timing Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._Administration within or into a vein or veins._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) needed to assess or examine the (potency of the) substance being used._A single dose of a drug or other substance given over a short period of time. It is usually given by infusion or injection into a blood vessel. It may also be given by mouth._The chronological relationship between temporal events._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Concepts.definition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Contrast Agent Test Dosing Unit Bolus Infusion Procedure Timing Method
Property.preferredDefinition: Administration within or into a vein or veins.:Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.:A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) needed to assess or examine the (potency of the) substance being used.:A single dose of a drug or other substance given over a short period of time. It is usually given by infusion or injection into a blood vessel. It may also be given by mouth.:The chronological relationship between temporal events.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.
A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) needed to assess or examine the (potency of the) substance being used.
A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time.
The chronological relationship between temporal events.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Activation of a system without outside interference.: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Activation of a system without outside interference.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The chronological relationship between temporal events.: A single dose of drug usually injected into a blood vessel over a short period of time.: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The chronological relationship between temporal events.
A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.: Delay; time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time.

Concepts.definition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
